choices.D: Traffic matching the SD-WAN rule is steered through port2.
choices.C: The SD-WAN members are monitored by different performance SLAs.
choices.B: Port2 is alive because its packet loss is lower than 10%.
choices.A: Port1 is dead because it does not meet the SLA target.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D refer to SD-WAN_6.4_Study_Guide page 61
Ans D is correct
D is correct. Interfaces are still alive if SLA targets are not met. Interfaces are dead if the failure threshold is met.
I think the correct answer is A , page 56

Selected Answer: C
C is the answer

Implicit rule is changed here to source-dest-ip-based

page 25 , C is correct

choices.D: All traffic from a source IP is sent to the same interface.
choices.A: All traffic from a source IP to a destination IP is sent to the least used interface.
choices.B: All traffic from a source IP is sent to the most used interface.
choices.C: All traffic from a source IP to a destination IP is sent to the same interface.

questions.question_text: Which three performance SLA protocols are available on the FortiGate CLI only? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ACD
ACD refer to SD-WAN_6.4_Study_Guide page 59
Correct ans is ACD

ACD is correct. Command output from a fortigate:

FW-01 (test-health-check) # set protocol 
ping Use PING to test the link with the server.
tcp-echo Use TCP echo to test the link with the server.
udp-echo Use UDP echo to test the link with the server.
http Use HTTP-GET to test the link with the server.
twamp Use TWAMP to test the link with the server.
dns Use DNS query to test the link with the server.
tcp-connect Use a full TCP connection to test the link with the server.
ftp Use FTP to test the link with the server.
Sorry ,, it's ACD

choices.A: Because you must use certificate full inspection on the firewall policy
choices.C: Because traffic can be steered based on application type
choices.B: Because the application database is manually maintained by administrators
choices.D: Because SD-WAN rules are independent from firewall policies to avoid controlling applications

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is correct

Selected Answer: C
C refer to SD-WAN_6.4_Study_Guide page 77

Selected Answer: C
ans is C
Ans is C guys. because in SDWAN, You can configure rules to steer traffic based on the application detected by Fortigate. This is know as application steering or application-aware routing
Sorry , it should be C . page 77
I think the correct answer is A

questions.question_text: Why is it effective to use SD-WAN rules when configuring application control?
Which statement about using BGP routes in SD-WAN is true?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A refer to SD-WAN_6.4_Study_Guide page 226
A is correct.
Ans is A
agreed , A is correct answer

choices.B: You must use BGP to route traffic for both overlay and underlay links.
choices.C: You must configure AS path prepending.
choices.A: Learned routes can be used as dynamic destinations in SD-WAN rules.
